title: Limiting deprecated lint output

labels.name: A-diagnostics
labels.description: Area: Messages for errors, warnings, and lints

labels.name: T-compiler
labels.description: Relevant to the compiler team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

body:
Given the following code: https://play.rust-lang.org/?version=stable&mode=debug&edition=2021&gist=f4b5234e06a28be1f975034f107e1367

```rust
#![allow(dead_code)]

#[deprecated]
fn baz() -> Foo {
    Foo::new()
}

#[deprecated]
struct Foo {
    bar: String,
}

impl Foo {
    fn new() -> Foo {
        Self {
            bar: String::default(),
        }
    }
}
```

The current output is:

```
   Compiling playground v0.0.1 (/playground)
warning: use of deprecated struct `Foo`
 --> src/lib.rs:4:13
  |
4 | fn baz() -> Foo {
  |             ^^^
  |
  = note: `#[warn(deprecated)]` on by default

warning: use of deprecated struct `Foo`
 --> src/lib.rs:5:5
  |
5 |     Foo::new()
  |     ^^^

warning: use of deprecated struct `Foo`
  --> src/lib.rs:13:6
   |
13 | impl Foo {
   |      ^^^

warning: use of deprecated struct `Foo`
  --> src/lib.rs:14:17
   |
14 |     fn new() -> Foo {
   |                 ^^^

warning: use of deprecated field `Foo::bar`
  --> src/lib.rs:16:13
   |
16 |             bar: String::default(),
   |             ^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^

warning: `playground` (lib) generated 5 warnings
    Finished dev [unoptimized + debuginfo] target(s) in 1.16s
```

<!-- The following is not always necessary. -->

I would argue that this code should not output any warnings, since all usages of deprecated items are, themselves, deprecated; there is no non-deprecated code using deprecated code.
